author: customer
text: RR has gone downhill. Last summer you lost an item I sent in to sell; my inquiries were ignored. Over the winter I bought 2 items which were not available due to an inventory error. January I requested that the money in my account be sent to me, didn’t happen and, again, inquiries ignored. So basically I’ll buy until I have no money left that you’re holding and won’t be sending anything else to sell. I’ve been a nano second from contacting the BBB but now you have only $17 and I’ll spend it eventually. Otherwise, this recent transaction went smoothly.

Once I untangled and polished the necklace, I was happy with it!
title: I’m only giving 3 stars because the…

author: customer
text: Your descriptions for most things are subpar.  I received a defective item that said minor fraying on belt with no pictures.  It was so bad, and the part that makes it a usable belt wasn’t even sewn anymore so that the belt just fell off with any sort of tension.  Then when chatting with your “customer service” I had to fight to get a full refund with the inclusion of the original shipping fee.  I have to wait minimum two weeks for a refund (not to count the transaction time from refund to credit card).  So I wasted so much of my precious time and have to wait so long for a refund.  You all should have the capital to take the time to take better pictures or at the very least write better description.  A customer service gesture that would actually show you value customers would be that in the meantime, you offered say a $25 site credit for my troubles and your mistake.
title: Your descriptions are terrible!

author: Jason A. Bivins
text: Gucci purse was listed in ‘Very Good condition’ this was not accurate. The clasp was heavily damaged. This was not mentioned in the item listing. It was also not made to be obvious that this was a ‘final sale.’ I would not have purchased the item if the description was reflective of the actual condition of the purse. Now my only recourse seems to be to consign back to TRR. I wonder how many times this purse has been sold and re-sold. I will not be a user of this platform again.
title: Product Description Was Wrong.

author: Mary Rash
text: Sweatshirt was NOT as described, said it had a light pull at the neck, but there were pulls and hanging threads at the neck, wrists and bottom all around. The other shirt I ordered was also listed as a sweatshirt, and is also pretty thin, but it's in good shape.
title: Sweatshirt was NOT as described

text:

Terrible experience.

author: K Russell
text: The reason I gave only 3 stars is because of your sizing issues. Twice now I’ve bought a piece that you’ve inaccurately listed a piece of clothing by the wrong size as meant by the designer. For example: NSF lists their pants by numeric sizes. 25, 26, 27 etc. but you guys list them as S,M, L etc. that’s super inaccurate. Because the difference between a 26 and 27 (though both listed by you as a small) is a huge difference. I’ve requested that you guys list your sizes as the designer does already but as of yet there is no change. It’s a bit of a crap shoot.
title: Sizing

author: Anzalone
text: After TRR sent out an solicitation saying 90's puffers were trending I decided to part with my prized late 90's Jean Charles de Castelbajac 3/4 length Grommet belted with a fur detachable collar, toggles and zip up a metallic matt gray on gray, name embroidered on the sleeve, lots of pockets, This was one serious piece of clothing in awesome good condition.If any coat had all the bells and whistles this one did. I didn't even think about the value of the coat knowing what i bought it for and full well that TRR would know what they had but unfortunately that was not the case. I realized about $100 in that sale because whoever listed it knew nothing about what they had. I'm no stranger to clothing it has been my business to know this so when I saw what had happened it was to late. The coat sold fast naturally but when i complained twice I was offered nothing in the way of compensation except they were sorry i was unhappy. I requested the other vintage item back a vintage Dolce and Gabbana 3/4 length leather distressed black leather, double breasted motorcycle coat with gray flannel lining and spared the same fate or not I wouldn't take the chance. they had tons of other stuff in the batch and truthfully I dont care, I believe in recycling clothes and finding life in used garments but this wont happen again.
title: After TRR sent out TRENDING 90's Puffers
